docs.abstract: Editorial warns of epidemic of youth obesity, particularly in minority communities; cites early emergence of weight-related chronic ailments in children
docs.lead_paragraph: That Americans are getting heavier is especially hard to deny the day after Thanksgiving. But America's weight problem has less to do with holiday binges than with everyday choices and circumstances. That's especially true for children, who are gaining weight in epidemic numbers, particularly in minority communities. Mexican-American and African-American children are twice as likely as non-Hispanic white children to have a body mass index of more than 25, the definition of overweight. In the last three decades, the number of overweight young Americans has tripled, with no sign the trend is abating. Far from being just the stuff of cruel schoolyard taunts, the issue has serious long-term implications. For the first time, children are being diagnosed with weight-related chronic ailments that usually strike much later in life, including hypertension and Type 2 diabetes, popularly known as adult-onset diabetes -- a name that now needs rethinking. These diseased children are at risk, as similarly stricken adults are, for heart and kidney troubles, blindness and limb amputation, but at an earlier age. Further, as odd as it seems, a number of these children suffer from malnutrition from the unhealthy diets that made them fat. As they age, they can be expected to strain the health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-29 Israeli Targets in Kenya Are Struck by Terrorists In coordinated assaults on Israelis near the Kenyan city of Mombasa, terrorists fired shoulder-launched missiles at an Israeli passenger jet, missing their target, minutes before three suicide bombers attacked an Israeli-owned hotel. The bombers killed themselves, at least 12 others, and wounded dozens more. A1 The missile attack on an Israeli passenger plane raised renewed fears of terrorists shooting down commercial aircraft. The fact that the Arkia airlines plane escaped what witnesses described as a pair of missiles did not diminish the concern. A32
